sub_topic: Probability of a certain type of travel outcome occurring on a trip
message_1: A traveler has a 20% chance of experiencing a delay on any given leg of their trip. If they have a 3-leg journey (i.e. with 2 connections), what is the probability they will experience a delay on at least one leg of their trip?
message_2:
To solve this problem, we can first find the probability that the traveler will not experience a delay on any leg of their trip, and then subtract that probability from 1 to find the probability of experiencing a delay on at least one leg.

The probability of not experiencing a delay on a single leg is 1 - 0.20 = 0.80 (or 80%).

For a 3-leg journey, the probability of not experiencing a delay on all three legs is 0.80 * 0.80 * 0.80 = 0.512 (or 51.2%).

Now, we subtract this probability from 1 to find the probability of experiencing a delay on at least one leg:

1 - 0.512 = 0.488 (or 48.8%).

So, the probability that the traveler will experience a delay on at least one leg of their 3-leg journey is 48.8%.
